title: UX Designer till konsultuppdrag i Stockholm
description:
Vi söker en kreativ och lösningsorienterad UX-designer för ett spännande konsultuppdrag hos en samhällsviktig aktör inom kollektivtrafiksektorn, med kontor i Stockholm. Uppdraget (heltid) pågår från den 29 oktober 2025 till den 29 oktober 2026 och utgår från kundens kontor, med möjlighet till hemarbete 2 dagar per vecka.
  
**Om rollen:** Som UX-designer blir du en nyckelperson i det agila App teamet, som ansvarar för utvecklingen av digitala försäljningskanaler. Du ingår i ett tvärfunktionellt team tillsammans med bland annat produktägare, utvecklare, testare och en team coach. Arbetet sker i nära samverkan med interna team, externa leverantörer samt andra design- och utvecklingsteam inom organisationen. Du rapporterar till teamets designlead och samverkar regelbundet med arkitekter och affärsförvaltare.
  
Exempel på arbetsuppgifter Driva konceptarbete och ta fram användarcentrerade designlösningar
  
Skapa detaljerade wireframes, prototyper och användarflöden
  
Förankra designlösningar hos utvecklingsteam och intressenter
  
Testa och iterera design utifrån användartester och feedback
  
Självständigt planera och genomföra användbarhetsstudier
  
Samverka med andra UX-designers inom organisationen för att säkerställa enhetlig användarupplevelse
  
Dokumentera och presentera designlösningar i relevanta forum
  
Arbeta i enlighet med tillgänglighetsprinciper enligt WCAG AA
  
  

**Om dig:**  

Vi söker dig som är kommunikativ, strukturerad och har ett genuint intresse för att skapa användarvänliga digitala upplevelser. Du är van att arbeta agilt i tvärfunktionella team och trivs i komplexa miljöer med många intressenter. Du har ett metoddrivet angreppssätt och stark vana av att arbeta med användarcentrerad design genom hela processen – från insikt till implementation.
  
**Erfarenhet och kompetens:** För att vara aktuell för uppdraget behöver du uppfylla följande krav:
  
Minst 6 års arbetslivserfarenhet som UX-/UI-designer inom mobilapplikationer (iOS och/eller Android)
  
Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av UX-design på heltid
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta strukturerat med användarcentrerad design, inklusive tillämpning av metoder som användarresor, intervjuer, prototyping och användartester (minst två uppdrag senaste 6 åren)
  
Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att självständigt planera och genomföra användbarhetsstudier med metoder som användartester, observationer, enkäter och intervjuer
  
Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att ta fram designskisser och interaktiva prototyper i Figma, inklusive användning av Designtokens och Variables
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av detaljdesign inom ett etablerat designsystem under minst 2 års tid (inom de senaste 7 åren)
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utvärdera design utifrån tillgänglighetsprinciper enligt WCAG AA (styrkt av minst två uppdrag)
  
Minst 2 års erfarenhet av designarbete i ett agilt, tvärfunktionellt utvecklingsteam
  
Minst 3 års eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande
  
  

**Följande erfarenheter är särskilt meriterande:**  

Erfarenhet från samarbete i större organisationer (minst 500 anställda) där flera avdelningar och externa leverantörer samverkar i gemensamma designprojekt
  
Arbetslivserfarenhet från designuppdrag med målgrupper som ställer extra höga krav på tillgänglighet, t.ex. personer med synnedsättning eller kognitiv funktionsnedsättning
  
  

Är du redo för denna utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan idag! Vi ser fram emot att få veta hur just du kan bidra till framgång i detta uppdrag.
  
Uppdraget För det här uppdraget anställs du som konsult på Digitalenta. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter ett gediget friskvårdsbidrag, försäkringar, förmånligt pensionssparande, konsultträffar och givetvis en engagerad konsultchef som finns tillgänglig för dig under hela anställningsperioden.

title: Designer
description:
***Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America’s accounting firms.***
*This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.*
*In just 9 months, we’ve hit strong product-market fit, are generating insanely fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future by expanding our already 30-person team with those who want to say “I was there when it all started.”*
*Read more → TechCrunch*
*⸻*
**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
*We’re looking for a Designer who can elevate every touchpoint of our brand. Your mission is simple yet critical: enable Filed to present a world-class digital and visual identity across all marketing touchpoints. You’ll make sure our design is consistent, clear, and creative—fueling growth, storytelling, and customer engagement.*
*You’ll move fast, balancing polish with speed. You’ll turn ideas into crisp visuals, pitch decks, campaigns, and websites that make people stop scrolling and start paying attention. If you love working across sales, product, and marketing—and thrive in bringing clarity through design—this role is for you.*
*As one of our earliest marketing team hires, you’ll help shape how we bring in, activate, and retain users. You’ll work closely with product, product design, sales, support, and—most importantly—our users to rethink how we grow and deliver value in a space most people thought couldn’t be changed.*
*⸻*
**Here’s Why This Is a Terrible Job**
* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect a campaign, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like HubSpot, Clearbit, and Census to move fast, test ideas in days, and launch quickly.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of user psychology, growth systems, and high-trust workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


*⸻*
***Here’s why it’s the best career choice you’ll make:***
* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll launch campaigns because you believe in them, not because they got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


*⸻*
**The Teammate We’re Looking For**
* Thrives at solving complex, systems-level marketing challenges
* Moves seamlessly between strategy, execution, and iteration
* Excited by the challenge of supporting multiple user journeys and teams
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative operator
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning measurable growth outcomes, not just running tasks


*⸻*
**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Driving updates and improvements to the Filed website that convert and engage
* Producing scroll-stopping animations and creative assets that fuel growth
* Owning the creation of high-impact sales decks, templates, and pitch assets
* Designing campaign-ready visuals across email, social, blog, and video
* Powering content and storytelling with crisp, clear, professional design
* Ensuring a consistent, world-class visual identity across every touchpoint


*⸻*
**Your Hard Skillset**
* Experience with web and digital design, ideally in a B2B SaaS context.
* Strong skills in Figma, Webflow, Jitter and other similar AI tools.
* Experience creating presentation templates, marketing visuals, and simple animations.
* Ability to work with templates and evolve them for brand consistency.
* Collaborative mindset to work across marketing, product, and leadership.
* Attention to detail, creative judgment, and ability to deliver quickly.
* Strong idea generator and executer.


*⸻*
**Your Soft Skillset**
* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for performance metrics
* Highly collaborative across product, sales, and support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


*⸻*
**Growth And Levels**
* We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
* We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
* This isn’t a comfy design role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
* You will launch fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.


*⸻*
**The Process**
* Quick intro call (30 minutes)
* Campaign walkthrough and async task (60 minutes)
* Final round with our team (120 minutes)


*In just 3.5 hours, you’ll be wanting early access—just like the rest of our team—to get into the stack and start building a generational company, even before your first day. Because you’ll see the opportunity to change your career trajectory—fast.*
 Compensation Range: $55K - $65K

title: Social Media & Content Intern
description:
Are you passionate about storytelling, AI, and nature? Then this is your chance to join a pioneering startup at the intersection of wildlife and techonology, and gain real-world experience while contributing to solutions that make a real difference in the world!
 




  





**Who is Flox?** 





 We are a tech startup designing wildlife management solutions powered by AI. Our mission is to make human-wildlife interactions safer, smarter, and more harmonious. Right now, we’re launching Flox Edge, the world’s first stationary AI-driven wildlife deterrent, and we need your help to take our social media to the next level.
 




  





**About the internship** 





 We’re looking for a motivated, creative, and curious Social Media & Content Intern to help us develop Flox’s unique voice across channels, tell engaging stories from the field, and inspire our growing community of partners, investors, and potential customers.
 




  





**What you'll be working on** 



* Creating and scheduling posts for our social media channels.
* Turning stories, data, and photos from Flox projects into engaging content.
* Helping shape campaigns for new projects, partnerships, and pilots.
* Supporting with community management and engaging with our audiences.
* Tracking performance and suggesting improvements.
* Helping position Flox as the industry leader by building trust & authority.
* Experimenting with new formats and creative ideas to make wildlife intelligence come alive online.



  





**Who are you?** 



* Currently studying marketing, communications, media, or a related field.
* Creative (and a bit wild) mindset with strong writing skills in English (Swedish is a plus).
* Curious about social media trends and storytelling.
* Comfortable using Adobe, Figma, Canva, or similar tools (video editing is a bonus).
* Curious, hands-on, and eager to test new ideas.
* Interested in sustainability, AI, and nature - and excited to learn how to talk about it.



  





**What we offer** 



* Hands-on experience with real impact and visibility.
* A strong portfolio of content created for a growing tech startup.
* Mentorship and feedback while also getting to take initiative and responsibilities from day one.
* Being part of a small and passionate startup team (and two dogs) with fast decisions and close collaborations.



  





**Some practical information** 



* Location: Stockholm (hybrid)
* Unpaid internship
* Time: start and duration are flexible, but the earlier the better.
* Both part-time or full-time.
* Deadline for applying: 12th of October (but the recruitment is ongoing, so the position might be filled before this date.)



  






 Does this sound like you? Send us your CV, portfolio (or similar), and a brief cover letter explaining why you’d like to join Flox. We’re exciting to hearing from you!

title: UX Designer - Crusader Kings 3
description:
**Are you an accomplished UX Designer looking for new and exciting challenges?**
 Do you love turning complex systems into elegant, intuitive experiences?
   

  

 Are you passionate about creating innovative solutions that enhance the player experience for strategy gamers?
   

  

 As a UX Designer on the Crusader Kings 3 team, you will help create intuitive, engaging interfaces that make our deep, complex grand strategy game more accessible and rewarding. You will challenge conventions, bring fresh ideas to the table, and push for innovations that make our game more approachable while maintaining its strategic depth.
   

  

 Working closely with fellow designers, you will also contribute to style guides and design methods that ensure a consistent, high-quality user experience across the game.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include**
* Designing and improving mockups, wireframes, and prototypes for new and existing interfaces
* Implement and iterate on your designs in-game using our in-house frontend scripting language
* Collaborating with designers, programmers, and artists to refine both UI and gameplay mechanics
* Work alongside the Audio Director on interface sound effects
* With a relentless focus on player value, driving innovation and bringing a fresh perspective to UI and UX design


**What We're Looking For**
* Professional experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer, or in a similar role
* Experience with scripting or basic programming
* Familiarity with PDS games; preferably Crusader Kings 3
* Fluency in English both written and spoken


 On a personal level, you have excellent communication skills and can easily communicate with fellow designers, programmers and other team members. You are organized, detail-oriented, and maintain well-structured style guides and design documentation.
   

  

 An interest in medieval history is considered an asset!
   

  

**Practical information**
**Scope** 
 : Full-time and permanent
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: UX Designer till uppdrag - 12 månader
description:
Vi söker en kreativ och lösningsorienterad UX-designer för ett spännande konsultuppdrag hos en samhällsviktig aktör inom kollektivtrafiksektorn, med kontor i Stockholm. Uppdraget (heltid) pågår från den 29 oktober 2025 till den 29 oktober 2026 och utgår från kundens kontor, med möjlighet till hemarbete 2 dagar per vecka.
 



  





**Om rollen:** 




 Som UX-designer blir du en nyckelperson i det agila App teamet, som ansvarar för utvecklingen av digitala försäljningskanaler. Du ingår i ett tvärfunktionellt team tillsammans med bland annat produktägare, utvecklare, testare och en team coach. Arbetet sker i nära samverkan med interna team, externa leverantörer samt andra design- och utvecklingsteam inom organisationen. Du rapporterar till teamets designlead och samverkar regelbundet med arkitekter och affärsförvaltare.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter** 



* Driva konceptarbete och ta fram användarcentrerade designlösningar
* Skapa detaljerade wireframes, prototyper och användarflöden
* Förankra designlösningar hos utvecklingsteam och intressenter
* Testa och iterera design utifrån användartester och feedback
* Självständigt planera och genomföra användbarhetsstudier
* Samverka med andra UX-designers inom organisationen för att säkerställa enhetlig användarupplevelse
* Dokumentera och presentera designlösningar i relevanta forum
* Arbeta i enlighet med tillgänglighetsprinciper enligt WCAG AA



  





**Om dig:** 




 Vi söker dig som är kommunikativ, strukturerad och har ett genuint intresse för att skapa användarvänliga digitala upplevelser. Du är van att arbeta agilt i tvärfunktionella team och trivs i komplexa miljöer med många intressenter. Du har ett metoddrivet angreppssätt och stark vana av att arbeta med användarcentrerad design genom hela processen – från insikt till implementation.
 



  





**Erfarenhet och kompetens:** 




 För att vara aktuell för uppdraget behöver du uppfylla följande krav:
 


* Minst 6 års arbetslivserfarenhet som UX-/UI-designer inom mobilapplikationer (iOS och/eller Android)
* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av UX-design på heltid
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta strukturerat med användarcentrerad design, inklusive tillämpning av metoder som användarresor, intervjuer, prototyping och användartester
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att självständigt planera och genomföra användbarhetsstudier med metoder som användartester, observationer, enkäter och intervjuer
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av att ta fram designskisser och interaktiva prototyper i Figma, inklusive användning av Designtokens och Variables
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av detaljdesign inom ett etablerat designsystem under minst 2 års tid
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att utvärdera design utifrån tillgänglighetsprinciper enligt WCAG AA
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av designarbete i ett agilt, tvärfunktionellt utvecklingsteam
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande



  





 Följande erfarenheter är särskilt meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet från samarbete i större organisationer (minst 500 anställda) där flera avdelningar och externa leverantörer samverkar i gemensamma designprojekt
* Arbetslivserfarenhet från designuppdrag med målgrupper som ställer extra höga krav på tillgänglighet, t.ex. personer med synnedsättning eller kognitiv funktionsnedsättning



  





 Är du redo för denna utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan idag! Vi ser fram emot att få veta hur just du kan bidra till framgång i detta uppdrag.
 



  





**Uppdraget** 




 För det här uppdraget anställs du som konsult på Digitalenta. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter ett gediget friskvårdsbidrag, försäkringar, förmånligt pensionssparande, konsultträffar och givetvis en engagerad konsultchef som finns tillgänglig för dig under hela anställningsperioden.

title: UX Lead - Workshop Suite, Traton
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Traton is in the middle of transforming how we deliver workshop tools and services across multiple brands. As part of this journey, we are now looking for a dedicated UX Lead to help build and champion a user-centered design culture within the the Workshop Suite product family.
   

  

 In this role, you will work closely with our external UX team (currently embedded in our product teams), as well as with product owners, system architects and developers.
   

  

 You will take responsibility for understanding user needs across brands and contexts, and ensuring that these insights are reflected in our design, development and strategy. You will also play a key part in shaping a long-term UX strategy for the workshop suite and the broader ecosystem — driving consistency, usability and value across our suite of tools.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Translate user needs into actionable requirements and support product owners in refining the backlog with a user-centric perspective.
* Collaborate closely with the external UX team to align research, interaction design and validation activities across development teams.
* Be an active contributor in strategic and visionary work — bringing the user’s voice into roadmaps, concepts and priorities.
* Work side-by-side with system and business architects to include usability and design thinking in architectural decisions.
* Communicate UX insights to stakeholders across the organization and help drive user advocacy in product planning and governance.
* Safeguard quality in user journeys and UX deliverables in collaboration with teams during implementation.
* Lead and maintain an overarching UX strategy for the workshop suite and connecting brands — driving consistency and cross-brand alignment.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a skilled UX professional with a strong background in UX design, service design, or product design—ideally gained in complex system environments. You are experienced in facilitating cross-functional collaboration and aligning UX goals with both business and technical needs.
   

  

 Confident in driving user research, you know how to synthesize insights and translate them into both strategic direction and hands-on improvements. You thrive in hybrid environments with multiple stakeholders, brands, and tools, and you are comfortable working across abstraction levels—from conceptual frameworks to detailed interface feedback.
   

  

 Proactive, structured, and passionate, you are motivated by the opportunity to improve the user experience at scale. Fluency in English is required, while Swedish is considered a plus.
   

  

 Meriting Experiences
   

  

  

* Experience leading or mentoring other designers or design teams.
* Understanding of developer workflows and collaboration in agile/DevOps teams.
* Knowledge of accessibility standards, UX maturity models, or design systems.
* Familiarity with Traton/Scania service processes and workshop tooling is a plus.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 You’ll join a team at the intersection of vehicles, diagnostics, and cutting-edge digital tools, working to transform the service business with smarter, more connected workshop solutions that make everyday work easier for mechanics across the globe. As part of TRATON Group R&D, you’ll also gain unique insights into the broader transportation industry and contribute to our transformation into a digital, multi-brand transport solution provider.
   

  

 Here, your curiosity and insights are valued in a collaborative environment where knowledge sharing, open dialogue, and problem-solving are at the core. You’ll be part of a growing product family with a strong culture of collaboration and the opportunity to shape how UX is embedded in the product organization. Together, we explore what’s next while keeping real users and real impact at the center of everything we do.
   

  

**TRATON Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-10-10. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please get in touch with Joel Rosén, recruiting manager, at joel.rosen@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Group R&D

title: CGI Visualization Artist
company_industry: Motor Vehicle Manufacturing and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:
**At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a CGI Visualization Artist.** 




  





**Scope of role** 




 We are seeking an experienced CGI Artist Consultant to support advanced 3D visualization efforts, including both still imagery and animation/video creation. You will collaborate closely with our customer's CGI specialist, forming a dedicated team that contributes throughout the entire design process—from early concept development to industrialization across various platforms.
 



  





 This role involves close interaction with the interior and exterior industrial design teams, CMF (Color, Material, Finish), Visual Graphics, and other cross-functional teams. The CGI team plays a vital role in enhancing the product User Experience (UX) and delivering a premium design experience within the context of sustainable heavy transport.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




 · Create photorealistic still imagery in both studio and product application contexts.
 



 · Produce high-quality animations/videos for design and communication purposes.
 



 · Support real-time visualization during design reviews and fixed deliveries.
 



 · Enable VR visualization using multi-headset setups.
 



 · Contribute to process and tool development for efficient, high-quality iterations.
 



 · Participate in agile workflows with 10-week PI (Program Increment) planning.
 



  





**Tools & Technologies** 




 · Primary tools: Autodesk VRED, Blender, After Effects
 



 · Emerging tools: Unreal Engine, Unity
 



 · Experience with game engines and real-time rendering is highly valued.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 · Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Industrial Design, Visualization, or a related field.
 



 · Proven experience in visualizing complex design projects.
 



 · Automotive industry experience is a plus.
 



 · Strong proficiency in the tools mentioned above.
 



 · Exceptional visual communication and storytelling skills.
 



 · Demonstrated ability to work in collaborative team environments.
 



 · Agile mindset with adaptability to varying project conditions.
 



 · Strong communication skills, both verbal and visual.
 



 · Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
 



  





**If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on and want to join a global company, then this is the place for you.** 




  





**Tata Technologies: Engineering a better world.** 




  





*Tata Technologies would like to thank all applicants for their interest, each application will be reviewed against the set criteria for the role. We would like to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear from us within 10 working days following the closing date it will mean that unfortunately your application has not been successful. We will however retain your details for any suitable future opportunities.*

title: Join the Funnel Talent Pool — Product, Dev & Design
description:
At Funnel, we're building the future of data-driven marketing and that takes an exceptional team. While we may not have your
 *exact* 
 dream role open today, we’re always looking for brilliant minds to join us in the future.
   

  

 Whether You're a Designer, Developer Or Product Manager, We’d Love To Connect. By Joining Our Talent Pool, You’ll Be The First To Know When Opportunities That Match Your Background And Passion Open Up In Our
   

  

**Development team**
 Craft scalable, high-performance systems with a clean and modern tech stack - Typescript/Javascript, React, Node, Rust, Python and AWS.
   

  

 We love great architecture, elegant code, and a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
   

  

**Product team**
 Drive clarity in complexity. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and shape a product that solves real-world problems for marketers around the world.
   

  

****Design team****
 Create intuitive, elegant, and empowering experiences. From UX research to UI design, our designers shape the way people interact with data every day.
   

  

*Please note: all Product, Dev and Design teams are based in office in Stockholm, Sweden.*
******What We Value******
* Curiosity: You ask why. And then ask it again.
* Autonomy: You don’t wait for permission to solve a problem.
* Collaboration: You thrive on working closely with others.
* Impact: You want your work to matter- to your team, our users, and the business.


******Why Funnel?******
* 🌍 International team with a strong in office culture
* 👥 Friendly, smart and welcoming people
* 🛠️ Modern tech, continuous delivery, and true product ownership
* 💚 Inclusive, supportive culture that invests in people
* 🧘 Generous time off, team offsites, and wellness benefits


******Learn more about Funnel!******
* Who are we - a founder’s story
* Product development at Funnel - ways of working
* Why we built a data ingestion platform - unique problems we’re solving


 Interested?
   

  

 Let’s not wait for the perfect job ad to get to know each other. Apply to our Talent Pool with your CV or LinkedIn profile and tell us what position/s you would be interested in and what kind of work you enjoy doing.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Start date:** 
 November 2025
   

  

**Duration:** 
 10 months
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, hybrid
   

  

**Extent:** 
 Fulltime 40 hours/week
   

  

 We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to join our clients' growing team and take ownership of a key product area. In this role, you will lead the full product lifecycle — from vision and strategy to execution and iteration — ensuring our products deliver strong business impact while solving real customer needs.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Define and communicate the product vision and roadmap, balancing long-term strategy with short-term priorities.
* Lead cross-functional collaboration with UX, tech, analytics, sales, business development, support, and marketing.
* Drive product discovery to reduce risks, validate assumptions, and identify new business opportunities.
* Manage and prioritize the product backlog, aligning stakeholders across the organization.
* Translate customer insights, data, and market trends into actionable product decisions.
* Act as the subject matter expert for your product portfolio, ensuring alignment between business goals and customer value.


**Job requirements**
* Minimum 5 years of experience in product management, working closely with UX, analytics, and tech teams.
* Proven track record in building and scaling commercial digital products, from concept to revenue.
* Strong background in product discovery, experimentation, and lean/agile methodologies.
* Skilled communicator, fluent in Swedish (written and spoken), with the ability to adapt messaging across diverse audiences.
* Demonstrated success in stakeholder management, aligning multiple functions and perspectives.
* Strong analytical skills, confident working with data to track performance, evaluate opportunities, and guide decisions.


 Bonus Points
   

  

 Experience in digital marketplaces and understanding of their dynamics.
   

  

 Background in B2B2C product development.
   

  

 Familiarity with the real estate industry or products aimed at professional agents.
   

  

**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Engineering Manager in Integrations and Connectivity | SEB, Stockholm
description:
With technology as our driving force, we provide world-class services to SEB group customers and business divisions in 20 sites worldwide. With us, you'll be part of a dedicated team of over 2800 employees who constantly work towards improving business development and growth. Do you want to work at the interface between ground-breaking technology and a world of financial flows? Welcome to SEB!
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join a dynamic department operating across Sweden and Lithuania, where innovation meets impact. You’ll lead a strategically important unit based in Stockholm, consisting of two agile teams (15 professionals in total) including Scrum Masters, Tech Leads, front- and back-end developers, and UX designer.
   

  

 Your teams are at the forefront of SEB’s API strategy—delivering the API Gateway and platform, and serving as a Centre of Excellence. They provide expert support and guidance to ensure the development of high-quality, standardized internal and external APIs.
   

  

 This unit plays a vital role within the Data, Connectivity & Analytics Tribe, part of the Business Infrastructure Domain.
   

  

**You Will Be Responsible For**
* Developing high-performing teams with outstanding commitment to common goals, mutual trust and respect, clarity around individual roles and responsibilities, and great collaboration.
* Maintaining a healthy IT portfolio of your team from a risk, security, cost, and compliance perspective.
* Hiring new staff, managing performance, coaching and mentoring team members.
* Communicate and closely interact with leading representatives at the different Business functions as well as with managers and architects within Tech.
* Driving SEB’s technical transformation agenda for your team’s portfolio for future proofing applications, data transformations, APIs and our journey to SaaS and cloud.
* Contributing to the department and extended management team.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe**
* You are an engaging leader with a genuine interest in people and technology.
* You are skillful in understanding and building great team dynamics.
* You have solid background in IT infrastructure, software development and operations.
* You have experience in Agile way of working with self-organizing cross functional teams.
* You have good understanding of the product management function and excel in communication and expectation management.
* You are fluent in verbal and written English.


**What We Offer**
* An international and empowering environment with highly skilled colleagues.
* Work-life balance & hybrid way of working.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* Exciting opportunity to be part of transforming an industry.
* Attractive compensation and benefits.


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 15th of October, 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Inesa Vanpoucke, Department Manager of Connectivity & API by mail inesa.vanpoucke@seb.se.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Product Owner - Software update, the Workshop Suite
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more: www.traton.com
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Are you passionate about delivering smart, connected solutions that improve how vehicles are maintained and supported in workshops? We are now looking for a Product Owner (PO) to lead the Software Update area within the Workshop Suite — a core capability that enables technicians to efficiently update vehicle systems across a wide range of workshop scenarios.
   

  

 As PO, you will take ownership of the direction and development of this product area. You will work closely with a dedicated development team and stakeholders across Scania to ensure that our software update tools are intuitive, well-integrated, and continuously evolving to meet the needs of workshops, service technicians, and downstream users.
   

  

 Your role will involve setting the product vision, maintaining a prioritized backlog, and aligning deliveries with customer expectations and SWS's broader strategy.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Define and drive the vision and roadmap for the Software Update product area.
* Maintain a clear and well-structured backlog with prioritized features and improvements.
* Collaborate daily with developers, designers, and testers to support efficient development workflows.
* Align the software update domain with other areas of the workshop suite to ensure a cohesive user experience.
* Translate real-world workshop needs into actionable development items and product decisions.
* Engage with internal stakeholders and end users to gather feedback and iterate continuously.
* Monitor the usage and impact of delivered features to guide future development.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a product-focused leader with experience in digital tools, embedded systems, or automotive software. You are used to working in an agile environment and skilled at managing backlogs, setting product direction, and guiding teams toward shared goals. With your strong communication skills, you thrive as the bridge between user needs and technical priorities.
   

  

 In a complex environment, you feel confident navigating both technical and operational perspectives, always with the ambition to create customer value and deliver real impact in the workshop. Your curiosity, structured way of working, and drive make you a strong force in shaping the solutions of tomorrow.
   

  

 Meriting Experiences:
   

  

  

* Knowledge of workshop tools, diagnostic systems, or vehicle communication protocols.
* Experience with embedded software updates or system-level integrations.
* Previous roles as Product Owner, Product Manager, Systems Engineer, or Scrum Master.
* Familiarity with Scania's workshop environments, connected tools, or service flows.
* Experience working with cloud-based platforms, cross-functional teams, and agile methods.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 You’ll join a team that sits at the intersection of vehicles, diagnostics, and cutting-edge digital tools. We’re working to transform our service business by creating smarter, more connected workshop solutions that make everyday work easier for mechanics across the globe.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a collaborative environment where your insights and curiosity are encouraged, and where the focus is on solving real problems for real users. We value knowledge sharing, open dialogue, and a willingness to explore what’s next – together.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry.
   

  

**TRATON Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-10-10. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please get in touch with Joel Rosén, recruiting manager, at joel.rosen@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Group R&D

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Join Greenely's mission to lead Europe's energy transition. We are dedicated to reducing household energy bills to zero by optimizing energy usage and enabling virtual power generation. As we navigate the complexities of the energy sector, we are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Product Manager to lead the development of the next generation of our platform. If you’re passionate about understanding customer needs, balancing commercial considerations, and driving impactful product strategies, we want you on our team.
 



  





 As a Senior Product Manager at Greenely, you will be at the heart of our product strategy, driving the vision, development, and growth of our innovative solutions. You will oversee the product lifecycle from ideation to launch, ensuring that our platform consistently meets and exceeds customer expectations while delivering commercial success. Your customer-focused approach will be instrumental in creating products that resonate with users and contribute to Greenely’s mission.
 



  





  





**Your daily impact, You drive towards:** 



* **Lead Product Strategy** 
 : Define and drive a product vision that aligns with Greenely’s mission and business goals. You will prioritize initiatives based on customer needs and commercial opportunities, ensuring the product roadmap delivers maximum value
* **Customer-Centric Innovation:** 
 Develop products that solve real customer problems and enhance their experience. You will gather insights, identify pain points, and translate these into innovative solutions that delight users and drive engagement
* **Balance Commercial Considerations** 
 : Ensure that product decisions take into account both customer satisfaction and business outcomes. You will work closely with sales, marketing, and finance teams to create products that are not only user-friendly but also commercially viable and scalable
* **Innovate and Execute:** 
 Lead the development of innovative products that integrate hardware and software, ensuring a seamless user experience. Your technical and industry expertise will help navigate complex challenges and bring cutting-edge solutions to market
* **Collaborate Across Teams:** 
 Work closely with engineering, data science, marketing, and operations teams to ensure cohesive product development and delivery. Your ability to bridge the gap between technical and business teams will be essential in bringing our products to life
* **Drive Market Growth** 
 : Identify market opportunities and drive product initiatives that support Greenely’s expansion. You will play a key role in scaling our platform, ensuring it meets the needs of a growing customer base and adapts to market dynamics
* **Ensure Quality and Performance:** 
 Take ownership of the product lifecycle, from concept to launch to post-launch performance. You will ensure that our products not only meet but exceed quality standards, driving continuous improvement and customer satisfaction.



  





**What you'll need to succeed:** 



* Proven experience (>5y) as a Senior Product Manager or in a similar lead role, with a strong track record of delivering customer-focused tech-products in a multi-product and multi-market environment.
* Strong background in product development, with hands-on experience and deep understanding of the intersection between hardware and software.
* Experience leading product strategy and execution in a growth-focused or scale-up business environment.
* Deep understanding of customer needs and the ability to translate them into successful product strategies.
* Strong commercial acumen, with experience balancing customer satisfaction with business objectives.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills, with a proven ability to collaborate effectively within and across cross-functional teams.
* A proactive approach to problem-solving, with a focus on driving innovative and commercially sound solutions.
* Proven experience with agile methodologies and a focus on continuous improvement. We place high emphasis on your interpersonal abilities at Greenely. Greenely's strength is drawn from team members who don't just do their job, but who actively shape the way we work. We seek individuals who naturally take charge, own their responsibilities with pride, and consistently hold themselves accountable. We're searching for someone who can gracefully navigate change, who sees challenges not as obstacles but as puzzles waiting to be solved, and who values the collective success of the teas.



  





**What we can offer you:** 



* *Flexibil* 
 ity: We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
* *Gro* 
 wth: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
* *Influence and Imp* 
 act: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
* *Innovative Environm* 
 ent: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.

title: Frontend Engineer, Healthtech
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Hospitals and Health Care, and Software Development
description:
**Join us in shaping better Healthcare!** 




 Platform24 is on a mission to unlock the potential of healthcare by creating smooth and accessible healthcare where patients and caregivers are empowered by the most intelligent technology available.
 



  





 Joining our team as a Frontend Engineer means playing a key role in one of Europe's most innovative health-tech tech companies, with the largest market adoption in the Nordics. You will have a significant impact and contribute to shaping the future of healthcare. Combining medical expertise with technology crafted by our engineers, we significantly improve healthcare quality and efficiency on a major scale.
 



  





 Our diverse team, consisting of frontend and backend engineers, QA, UX designers, a product manager, and an engineering manager, collaborates closely to achieve these objectives.
 



 You and your team will have end-to-end ownership of your area of Platform24's solutions, which encompasses everything from the UI to backend services and DevOps.
 



  





**What you will be doing:** 



* Implement responsive and user-friendly designs using Typescript and React.
* Participate in and contribute to software architecture discussions
* Troubleshoot and resolve frontend issues
* Ensure that the services are performing according to expectations in production
* Collaborate with the other members of your cross-functional team to ensure the creation of high-quality products
* Contribute to our ways of working every day, improving how we collaborate and do things



  





**What we offer:** 



* Working collaboratively with diverse teams
* Working in a structured and systematic way
* Language learning courses
* Friendly environment, flexible work hours, and promote work-life balance



  





**This is how you will succeed:** 



* You are comfortable in frontend development (preferably React and Typescript, and React-Native)
* You have experience working with State management, like Redux or React Query
* You have experience working with testing tools
* You have experience with code bundlers and module federation
* You are a team player with good collaboration skills
* You are curious to learn new technologies
* You have strong communication skills in English
* You have a university degree in Software Engineering or equivalent



  





**Being part of the P24 Team:** 




 At Platform24, we understand that everyone has unique needs when it comes to organizing their lives. That's why we prioritize flexible working hours to promote work-life balance for all. Additionally, we host Demo & Beers sessions every other week, providing a platform to share our achievements (beers optional!). We prioritize personal growth and offer a range of benefits, including the opportunity to dedicate five workdays a year to volunteer work. Our office is stocked with snacks, and we host regular parties. Moreover, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with intelligent, friendly, and talented colleagues from all over the world.
 



 Our culture is one of our strongest competitive advantages and through our behavior, we are all part of recreating it every day while building healthcare 2.0.
 



  





**Apply:** 




 If you believe we're the right workplace for you and you're the right fit for us, submit your application today! We conduct ongoing interviews, so we encourage you to apply soon..
 



 We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.
 



 This role is a full-time employment with Platform24. We do not offer contractor and/or B2B types of engagements.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
company_industry: Furniture and Home Furnishings Manufacturing, Advertising Services, and Marketing Services
description:
**VI SÖKER** 




 Är du passionerad kring digital kommunikation och vill arbeta med några av Skandinaviens mest välkända designvarumärken? Lammhults Design Group söker nu en Digital Marketing Manager som vill ta ett helhetsgrepp om den digitala närvaron och driva utvecklingen framåt både strategiskt och operativt.
 



  





**ARBETSBESKRIVNING** 




 Som Digital Marketing Manager blir du en nyckelperson i marknadsteamet med ansvar för att utveckla och optimera den digitala marknadsföringen. Du leder arbetet med strategi, kampanjer, SEO/SEM, Marketing Automation, webb och sociala medier med målet att både bygga varumärke och driva konvertering.
 



  





 Du kommer att spela en central roll i koncernens internationella expansion och får arbeta i inspirerande lokaler i Stockholm eller Oslo. Här blir du en del av ett kreativt, engagerat team och får möjlighet att påverka och utveckla framtidens digitala kommunikation i ett designfokuserat bolag i förändring.
 



  





**DIN PROFIL** 




 Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, drivande och har en bred kompetens inom digital marknadsföring både strategiskt och operativt. Du har ett analytiskt öga för data och resultat, samtidigt som du är kreativ och trivs med att omsätta idéer till konkreta aktiviteter. Du är självgående men uppskattar också att arbeta nära ett team, där du kan inspirera och driva samarbeten framåt. Med din affärsmässiga förståelse ser du helheten och kan prioritera rätt insatser för att skapa långsiktigt värde.
 



  





**Du har:** 




 · 3-5 års erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring på nordisk och internationell nivå.
 



 · Djup kunskap inom SEO/SEM, konvertering och webbanalys.
 



 · Gedigen erfarenhet av att utveckla och optimera hemsidor med fokus på UX och konvertering.
 



 · Erfarenhet av Marketing Automation, goda kunskaper i HubSpot MA och CRM.
 



 · Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
 



  





**OM FÖRETAGET** 




 På Lammhults Design Group förenar vi inte bara starka varumärken – vi multiplicerar deras styrkor. Vi är ett hem för några av Skandinaviens främsta designvarumärken, där olika uttryck och distinkta identiteter samlas under en gemensam filosofi. Här möts tidlös estetik och funktion, innovation drivs av hållbarhet, och vår design sätter alltid människan i centrum.
 



  





 Varje varumärke har sin unika röst – men tillsammans skapar vi ett värde som är större än summan av delarna. Genom nära partnerskap, digitala verktyg och gedigen erfarenhet förverkligar vi visioner och formar miljöer – med helhetslösningar, smidiga processer och personlig vägledning. Med över 400 års samlad kunskap och expertis är vår ambition inte bara att driva designen framåt – vi multiplicerar möjligheterna.
 



  





 Koncernen består av välkända varumärken som Abstracta, Fora Form, Lammhults Möbel och Ragnars – alla med starka positioner på både den nordiska och internationella marknaden. Med rötter i designtradition och ett tydligt fokus på innovation, hållbarhet och kvalitet skapar vi produkter som används världen över i kontor, offentliga miljöer och hem.
 



  





**ÖVRIG INFORMATION** 




 Är du redo att ta nästa steg? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag och bli en del av Lammhults Design Groups resa mot framtidens design och digitala kommunikation. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering i Stockholm eller Oslo. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.

title: Product Lead, Courier Acquisition & Onboarding
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join the Courier Acquisition & Onboarding team within the Courier product group. This team sits at the heart of Wolt’s growth. Our job is to ensure that anyone who wants to become a courier partner can discover Wolt, apply with ease, and get on the road quickly, confidently, and compliantly. We own the full funnel: from first touchpoint to activation, and everything in between. We obsess over removing friction, personalizing journeys for different markets, and building an onboarding experience that’s not only fast and efficient but also welcoming and supportive because the start of a courier’s journey defines the quality of our service for everyone.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll lead Wolt’s courier acquisition funnel from awareness to onboarding and activation. You’ll own the product vision and roadmap, identifying and addressing funnel bottlenecks through data, experimentation, and rapid iteration.
   

  

 Working cross-functionally with marketing, operations, engineering, design, and data, you’ll build seamless, scalable onboarding experiences. You’ll deeply understand courier needs and champion their journey, ensuring every step, from discovery to activation, is optimized and delightful.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience in product management, growth, or marketing roles, with a strong track record managing user or merchant acquisition funnels, onboarding flows, or conversion journeys. Experience in logistics, gig economy, or three-sided marketplaces is a plus, but not required.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders. You communicate clearly, bring stakeholders together, and drive alignment in fast-moving, multicultural environments.
* Desire to be in a high-ownership, high-visibility role. You're comfortable driving the strategic vision while also getting hands-on, solving complex problems, and navigating ambiguity with a builder’s mindset.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding, and business savvy — paired with the go-getter attitude of a “could-be startup CEO.” You’re confident digging into data, defining metrics, building dashboards, and running A/B tests — always balancing evidence with intuition.
* Expertise in leading cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and data experts. You’re passionate about great UX and know how to collaborate with designers to ship beautiful, intuitive products.


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
description:
**WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING**
 We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences - the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.
   

  

 AMD together we advance\_
   

  

**The Role**
 AMD is looking for a full-stack software engineer to join the AMD Silo AI, SiloGen applications team. In this role, you’ll help design and build secure and reliable web-based UIs and backend services that support Machine Learning workflows. We’re looking for someone at least
 **2** 
**years of professional experience** 
 in software development, preferably with exposure to both front-end and back-end technologies.
   

  

 You will contribute to the development, testing, deployment, and support of scalable software systems.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack Includes**
* Python
* React
* Typescript
* PostgreSQL
* Kubernetes
* Cloud environments (Oracle and others)
* AMD GPU hardware


**The Person**
 You’re a hands-on engineer who enjoys working across the stack and solving real-world problems. You care about clean code, scalable systems, and impactful collaboration.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Contribute to designing and developing web applications using modern front-end and back-end technologies
* Work closely with product, design, and engineering teams to implement new features
* Ensure UI/UX designs are feasible, performant, and user-friendly
* Optimize code and applications for speed, reliability, and scalability
* Participate in code reviews and discussions to support code quality and team learning
* Investigate and help resolve technical challenges
* Stay curious and keep learning new tools and frameworks


**Academic Credentials**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field


**LOCATION:**
 Sweden or Finland
   

  

*Benefits offered are described:* 
 AMD benefits at a glance
 *.*
*AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.*
